title: CBS’ 'Madam Secretary' Wins USA TODAY’s 22nd Annual Save Our Shows Poll
text:
USA TODAY today announced CBS’ “Madam Secretary” as the winner of its 22nd Annual Save Our Shows poll, which lets fans vote to keep or drop broadcast network shows hovering “on the bubble” between renewal and cancellation. ABC's freshman dramas "The Rookie" and "Whiskey Cavalier" also generated strong support from fans, placing second and third respectively in this year’s rankings of the 26 comedies and dramas.

Earning top honors after 90,000 votes were cast, “Madam Secretary,” starring Tea Leoni, was picked for renewal by 53% of voters. Just 20% voted for CBS to drop the fifth-season drama about a female professor recruited as Secretary of State.

“The Rookie,” a police series about Los Angeles' oldest rookie cop, followed “Madam Secretary” in the poll, with 50% of voters picking to keep it. “Whiskey Cavalier,” a newcomer about dueling CIA and FBI agents who team up on spy missions, rounded out the top three with 48% support for renewal.

Breaking down the numbers by gender, "Madam Secretary," "Whiskey" and "Rookie" were the top picks among women, followed by NBC's "The Enemy Within" and CBS' "MacGyver." Men ranked "Whiskey" first, followed by "Madam," "Rookie," CBS comedy "Life in Pieces" and NBC's "Blindspot."

At the bottom of the poll were CW’s “All American,” with 8% support, and Fox’s “Star,” with only 5%. The CBS revival of "Murphy Brown" had the highest percentage of voters seeking to kill it – 39%.

NBC’s time-travel drama “Timeless” topped USA TODAY’s Save Our Shows poll in 2018, which set records for voter turnout, and ended up returning for a two-hour series finale that aired last December. “Timeless” also won the poll in 2017, and the network subsequently reversed its decision to cancel the show, crediting fans’ support. Two shows in this year’s poll – "All American" and CW's "Roswell, New Mexico" – have already received news of renewal. The rest of the series that remain “on the bubble” will have their fates determined by the broadcast networks by mid-May.

“The entertainment landscape is a crowded place these days, and now more than ever fans need an outlet for their voice to be heard,” said Alison Maxwell, managing editor of USA TODAY’s Life section. “We’re thrilled they turn to us and are happy to be an advocate for our readers.”

description: CBS’ ‘Madam Secretary,’ ABC’s ‘The Rookie,’ and ABC’s ‘Whiskey Cavalier’ were fans’ three favorites for renewal.
